abstract.p: Brazil reports trade surplus of $183 million in April despite strike that paralyzed commerce at beginning of month; Brazil closes out first four months of year with surplus of $209 million, compared with deficit of $782 million a year earlier; average daily exports increased 18.7 percent over April 1999 (S)

block.p: In an indication of Brazil's strengthening economy, the country registered a trade surplus of $183 million in April despite a strike of customs workers that virtually paralyzed commerce at the beginning of the month. Brazil closed out the first four months of the year with a surplus of $209 million, compared with a deficit of $782 million a year earlier. Led by electronic transmission devices and soybeans, Brazil's average daily exports increased 18.7 percent last month over April 1999.

Led by electronic transmission devices and soybeans, Brazil's average daily exports increased 18.7 percent last month over April 1999.
